net.sourceforge.waters.model.expr
Class SimpleExpressionProxy

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.waters.model.base.ElementProxy
      net.sourceforge.waters.model.module.ExpressionProxy
          net.sourceforge.waters.model.expr.SimpleExpressionProxy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable, Proxy
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractBinaryExpressionProxy, EnumSetExpressionProxy, IdentifierProxy, IntConstantProxy, UnaryExpressionProxy
public abstract class SimpleExpressionProxy
extends ExpressionProxy
implements Comparable

The abstract base class of all expressions. This is the abstract base class of all expressions defined in the net.sourceforge.waters.model.expr package. This includes all expressions except event lists (EventListExpressionProxy).

Author:
Robi Malik

Field Detail

TYPE_INT

public static final int TYPE_INT
A type bit indicating an expression of integer type.

See Also:
getResultTypes(), Constant Field Values

TYPE_ATOM

public static final int TYPE_ATOM
A type bit indicating an expression of atom type. An atom is a simple identifier without indexes, as it may occur as a value in an enumeration type.

See Also:
getResultTypes(), Constant Field Values

TYPE_RANGE

public static final int TYPE_RANGE
A type bit indicating an expression of range type. A range is a list of values, either an integer range such as 1..10 or an enumerated range such as {a, b, c}.

See Also:
getResultTypes(), Constant Field Values

TYPE_NAME

public static final int TYPE_NAME
A type bit indicating an expression representing a name. Name expressions are used to identify events or other module components. They may be simple identifiers or identifiers with array indexes.

See Also:
getResultTypes(), Constant Field Values

TYPE_ANY

public static final int TYPE_ANY
All possible type bits. This constant represents a disjunction of all possible type bits. It can used to bypass type checking.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

compareTo

public int compareTo(Object partner)
Compares this simple expression to another. This method establishes a linear ordering on all expressions, which is roughly, but not perfectly, alphabetical.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface Comparable

eval

public abstract Value eval(Context context)
                    throws EvalException
Evaluates this expression. This method evaluates all operators occurring in the expression and looks up all identifiers in the context, until a primitive object can be returned as value. It is an error if an identifier that is not defined in the given context is encountered.

Parameters:
context - The binding context to be used to look up the values for identifiers.
Returns:
A value object representing the result of evaluation.
Throws:
EvalException - to indicate that the expression cannot be evaluated in the given context, because of type or similar errors.

getResultTypes

public abstract int getResultTypes()
Gets the possible type of the result of this expression. This method provides a light-weight type checking facility, providing only a rough guess for the possible type without taking context into account. An integer constant will be correctly classified as integer, while an identifier may be of any type because the context is not known.

Returns:
A bit mask composed of the values TYPE_INT, TYPE_ATOM, TYPE_RANGE, and TYPE_NAME. Bits are set exactly if the expression may have the corresponding type.

evalToInt

public IntValue evalToInt(Context context)
                   throws EvalException
Evaluates this expression to an integer. This method calls eval() to evaluate this expression and then checks whether the result is an integer value.

Parameters:
context - The binding context to be used to look up the values for identifiers.
Returns:
An integer value object representing the result of evaluation.
Throws:
TypeMismatchException - to indicate that the expression does not evaluate to an integer.
EvalException - to indicate that the expression cannot be evaluated in the given context.

evalToIndex

public Value evalToIndex(Context context)
                  throws EvalException
Evaluates this expression to an index. This method calls eval() to evaluate this expression and then checks whether the result can be used as an array index, i.e., whether it is an integer or an enumeration atom.

Parameters:
context - The binding context to be used to look up the values for identifiers.
Returns:
A value object representing the result of evaluation.
Throws:
TypeMismatchException - to indicate that the expression does not evaluate to an integer or atom.
EvalException - to indicate that the expression cannot be evaluated in the given context.

evalToRange

public RangeValue evalToRange(Context context)
                       throws EvalException
Evaluates this expression to a range. This method calls eval() to evaluate this expression and then checks whether the result is a range.

Parameters:
context - The binding context to be used to look up the values for identifiers.
Returns:
A range value object representing the result of evaluation.
Throws:
TypeMismatchException - to indicate that the expression does not evaluate to a range.
EvalException - to indicate that the expression cannot be evaluated in the given context.

evalToBoolean

public boolean evalToBoolean(Context context)
                      throws EvalException
Evaluates this expression to a boolean. This method calls eval() to evaluate this expression to an integer, and then converts it to a boolean value.

Parameters:
context - The binding context to be used to look up the values for identifiers.
Returns:
true if the result of evaluation was a non-zero integer, false if the result was zero.
Throws:
TypeMismatchException - to indicate that the expression does not evaluate to an integer.
EvalException - to indicate that the expression cannot be evaluated in the given context.

evalToName

public String evalToName(Context context)
                  throws EvalException
Evaluates this expression to a name. This method calls eval() to evaluate this expression, checks whether the result is an identifier, and returns the identifier's name.

Parameters:
context - The binding context to be used to look up the values for identifiers.
Returns:
The name of the identifier obtained from evaluation.
Throws:
TypeMismatchException - to indicate that the expression does not evaluate to an identifier.
EvalException - to indicate that the expression cannot be evaluated in the given context.

getTypeName

public static String getTypeName(int mask)
Gets a readable representation of a type mask.

Parameters:
mask - A bit mask composed of the values TYPE_INT, TYPE_ATOM, TYPE_RANGE, and TYPE_NAME.
Returns:
A string that represents the type mask and can be presented to the user.
